name: 柯萊恩
objective: We will be reading four novels in this semester’s course—or potentially five, depending on if you count Lewis Carroll’s Alice’s Adventures in Wonderland and Through the Looking Glass as two novels or one.  Anyway all the novels are British (some decidedly so) and all involve marvelous journeys through space and time.  They range in nature from the (inspiredly) silly (Alice’s aforementioned adventures) to the satirical (Jonathan Swift’s Gulliver’s Travels), from the poignant horror of the Romantic grotesque (Mary Shelley’s Frankenstein) to a Modernist mindscape weaving inner and outer of life and time (Virginia Woolf’s The Waves).  Emphasis will be laid upon going beyond the (often delightful) details of plot to appreciate the nuance woven into the language used by each of these four classic authors.  We will also examine other related (very short) works of literature that shed light upon the principle texts.  It is my hope that we will learn to appreciate the spiritual, aesthetic, political and philosophical usages, demands and delights of literature in general and the novel in particular.
